articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Ugandan President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Ugandan President
Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on January 21 sent a message of greetings to Yoweri Kaguta Museveni, President of Uganda, on the day of the victorious national resistance movement in Uganda.
					The Korean people are rejoiced over the fact that the friendly Ugandan people have registered signal successes in the efforts to ensure political stability and peace of the country and achieve the economic prosperity under the leadership of the President, Kim said in the message.
					
					Expressing belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, he wished the President success in his work to improve the overall living standard of the people on a higher stage through smooth implementation of the new Five-Year Plan for National Development.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Indian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Indian President
Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greetings to Pratibha Devisingh Patil, President of India, on the occasion of the Day of the Republic of India.
					 I am rejoiced over the fact that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and India are invariably developing on good terms despite the complicated international situation, Kim in the message said. He expressed belief that the bilateral relations would grow stronger in various fields in conformity with the common interests of the two peoples.
					
					He heartily wished the President good health and the Indian people greater progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets Indian PM
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Greets Indian PM
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim Monday sent a message of greetings to his Indian counterpart Manmohan Singh on the Day of the Republic of India.
					 Expressing belief that the favorably developing relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in politics, economy and other fields, the message wished the prime minister and the people of India greater success in their work for the development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Friendship Meeting with Russian Embassy Officials Held
articles.content:
Friendship Meeting with Russian Embassy Officials Held 
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Ministry of Foreign Affairs arranged a friendship meeting with staff members of the Russian embassy here on Tuesday on the occasion of the New Year. 
					 Present there on invitation were Ambassador Valery E. Sukhinin and staff members of the embassy.
					
					 Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun and officials of the ministry were on hand. 
					
					 Speeches were made before the participants talked to each other about the need to boost the relations between the two countries.

articles.title: Lunar New Year's Meeting for DPRK-China Friendship Opens
articles.content:
Lunar New Year's Meeting for DPRK-China Friendship Opens
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- An opening ceremony of the lunar New Year's joint meeting for DPRK-China friendship was held at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club Tuesday.
					Displayed in the venue of the ceremony were photos on the China visit by General Secretary Kim Jong Il last year, the performances of opera "A Dream of Red Mansions" given by the Phibada Opera Troupe in China, those introducing China and handicrafts made by Chinese.
					
					 Present there were Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, members of the DPRK-China Friendship Association, officials concerned and working people in the city.
					
					 Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy and Chinese guests staying in the DPRK were among those present there.
					
					 Jon Yong Jin and Liu Hongcai spoke at the opening ceremony.
					
					 Kim Jong Il visited China twice last year and made undying contribution to the development of the bilateral friendly relations, the speakers said.
					
					 They expressed the will to boost the traditional friendly relations provided and cultivated by the revolutionaries of the elder generation this year, too, which marks the 50th anniversary of the signing of the DPRK-China Treaty of Friendship, Cooperation and Mutual Assistance.
					
					 The participants enjoyed a DPRK-China joint folk music performance presented by teachers and students of Pyongyang Kim Won Gyun Conservatory and artistes of the Dandong City Song and Dance Troupe.

articles.title: State Degrees and Titles Awarded to Intellectuals
articles.content:
State Degrees and Titles Awarded to Intellectuals
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- State academic degrees and titles were awarded on Tuesday to intellectuals for their scientific and technological gains in the DPRK.
					 At an awarding ceremony the title of candidate academician was conferred on Pak Hong Gyu, a researcher of Kim Il Sung University, Jong Kyong Se, head of a department of Pyongyang University of Medicine of Kim Il Sung University, Kim Chang Won, a teacher of Kim Chaek University of Technology, Jon Kuk Bu, a researcher of the State Academy of Sciences, and Ri Yong Hwan, a researcher of the Academy of Social Sciences.
					
					 Professorship went to Pak Yong Ju, room chief of Pyongyang University of Medicine of Kim Il Sung University, and Choe Jae Gum, head of a department of Hamhung University of Chemical Engineering.
					
					 Kim Yong Su, a former unconverted long-term prisoner, Kim Won Man, room chief of Kim Chaek University of Technology, and others won doctorate.
					
					 49 intellectuals were honored with associate professorship.

articles.title: Korea Elderly Care Fund Established
articles.content:
Korea Elderly Care Fund Established
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The Korea Elderly Care Fund (KECF) was newly established in the DPRK. It is a non-profit, non-governmental organization registered as its legal body in the DPRK with a mission of giving cooperation and support to the old people so that they may live a healthy and worthwhile life. 
					 It will be operated by the funds created by the institution for protecting the aged and those donated by international organizations, charity organizations and overseas compatriots and others.
					
					 The funds will be used for repairing and renovating comprehensive service facilities for the aged and old people's homes and building welfare facilities for them. 
					
					 They will be also used for producing and distributing various kinds of publications necessary for the management and protection of the old people's health, setting up apparatuses for their physical training and rehabilitation and producing tonic, etc. 
					
					 A national computer network will be established in different parts of the country to care for the old people. 
					
					 Ri Chol Hui, vice-chairperson of the Central Committee of the Korean Federation of Protecting Aged Persons, 63, noted that KECF would reenergize the exchange and cooperation with different countries and international organizations.

articles.title: New Type Billboard Lighting Device Produced
articles.content:
New Type Billboard Lighting Device Produced
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- A new type billboard lighting device was produced in the DPRK. 
					 It is a combination of plastic forming and LED. The white color signboard is marked with letters of diverse calligraphic styles in various colors. 
					
					 This billboard lighting can be used for a long time. Much less fund is needed for making this device than other device and it can save 60 percent of electricity as compared with that consumed by a fluorescent lamp.
					
					 These billboard lighting devices are being installed in Pyongyang and other cities. 
					
					 Those billboard lighting devices installed at Pyongyang Department Store No. 1, restaurants in the Changgwang Street of Chain of Restaurants, the electronic amusement house in Kaeson Youth Park and other catering services and amusement facilities add to the scenic beauty of the city at night and in daytime.

articles.title: US-S. Korea Anti-DPRK War Moves Flayed -- Minju Joson
articles.content:
US-S. Korea Anti-DPRK War Moves Flayed -- Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Minju Joson, a major newspaper of the DPRK, condemned the recent U.S.-south Korea secret talks in south Korea as a dangerous confab for a war against the DPRK, which might aggravate the situation of the Korean Peninsula.
					 Sometime ago U.S. Secretary of Defense Gates visited south Korea to have closed-door talks with its high-ranking officials over anti-DPRK scheme. At the military talks in particular, they discussed about how to stage the south Korea-U.S. combined military exercises and develop the "strategic alliance" over "additional provocation" by someone.
					
					 Commenting on this fact, a news analyst of the newspaper Tuesday said:
					
					 Last year the U.S. craftily promoted the military nexus between south Korea and Japan by means of involving Japan in the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises and south Korea in the U.S.-Japan joint military exercises.
					
					 Its intention is to turn this military nexus into military alliance so as to use it for the implementation of the America policies towards the DPRK and Asia more effectively.
					
					 The reactionaries of Japan, too, are working hard to build the military alliance with south Korea at the instigation of the U.S.
					
					 Their ulterior intention is to contain other Asian countries, realize its ambition for reinvasion and become the leader of the region through the establishment of the military alliance with south Korea and the U.S.-led triangular military alliance involving Japan and south Korea.
					
					 The authorities of south Korea must be well aware of such intention of the U.S. and Japan.
					
					 Nevertheless, they have invited the military bosses of the U.S. and Japan from the outset of the year to have confabs for war against the DPRK. The facts show that they remain unchanged in the policy of dependence on outside forces and confrontation with their fellow countrymen, a treacherous policy.

articles.title: Common Interests, Starting Point of Inter-Korean Dialogue
articles.content:
Common Interests, Starting Point of Inter-Korean Dialogue
						
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- It is the consistent stand of the DPRK to meet the interests of all Koreans by promoting reconciliation and confidence between the north and the south and ensuring a peaceful settlement of the country's reunification issue through dialogue and cooperation, according to a bylined article of Rodong Sinmun Tuesday.
					 The inter-Korean dialogue is a prerequisite for resolving important matters of the nation and its common interests are essential precondition for resuming the stalled talks, said the article.
					
					 The north and the south should prioritize their common interests such as the peace and security on the Korean Peninsula and the reunification of the country. Only then can they restart the dialogue and achieve the expected success, it said, adding:
					
					 Foreign forces are getting serious in the efforts to meet their own interests, taking advantage of the complicated north-south relations. The reality calls on both sides to approach all the issues with reason and responsibility with the destiny of the nation into consideration.
					
					 To put the interests of a specified class or social stratum above those of the nation will never help solve any issue arising in the north-south relations. Instead, this will jeopardize the destiny of the nation in the end.
					
					 It is proved by the confrontation between the north and the south that has escalated during the last three years, leading the situation to the brink.
					
					 To realize the north-south dialogue at present, it is necessary to remove the misunderstanding and distrust contrary to it, to begin with, and take the stand of giving top priority to the common interests of the nation.
					
					 The north-south dialogue can develop into genuine one based on respect and trust in each other only when the north and the south put their common interests above all.
					
					 There is no reason whatsoever for south Korea not to accept the DPRK's sincere proposal for dialogue if it acts with reason in the common interests of the nation. The destiny of the north-south relations entirely depends on the attitude of the south Korean authorities.

articles.title: Suppression of Reunification Champion in S. Korea Flayed
articles.content:
Suppression of Reunification Champion in S. Korea Flayed
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The Seoul Central District Court recently staged a trial for Rev. Han Sang Ryol, who visited Pyongyang last year, and sentenced him to five-year jail and five-year suspension of qualifications.
					 Commenting on this fact, a news analyst of the DPRK newspaper Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says:
					
					 It is a violent encroachment upon justice and conscience of a human being and a wanton violation of the nation's desire for the country's reunification. 
					
					 Han Sang Ryol is a patriot as he visited Pyongyang, unable to see idle the reality of the inter-Korean relations inching close to the brink of a war and determined to dedicate himself to national unity and reunification.
					
					 He never served as a "tool" of somebody but acted of his own patriotic will to work for reunification.
					
					 It is self-evident that call for national harmony and reunification and opposition to foreign forces' domination and interference can never be "admiration and sympathy" with somebody.
					
					 Han's deeds can never be incriminated as they were prompted by the people's desire and demand for improved north-south relations, peace and reunification.
					
					 Reunification means patriotism and justice, and those working for it should be praised as a patriot.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should repeal the heavy penalty imposed upon Rev. Han at once and set him free without condition. They should also abolish the "National Security Law" at an early date, a fascist law obstructive to the development of free reunification movement and the process of reconciliation between the north and the south.

articles.title: Japanese Defense Minister's Reckless Remarks under Fire
articles.content:
Japanese Defense Minister's Reckless Remarks under Fire
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Japanese Defense Minister Kitazawa was recently reported to have said it is urgent for Japan's "security" to deepen an institutional discussion on such issues as providing effective support as regards the support of the Japan "Self-Defense Forces" to the U.S. forces in "contingency on the Korean Peninsula," etc.
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard: 
					
					The attempt of Japan to revise the "law on the situation in the surrounding areas" betrays its sinister aim to realize its ambition for reinvasion at any cost through military cooperation with the U.S.
					
					 Citing facts to prove that Japan is putting spurs to its moves for overseas expansion, tightening the military alliance with the U.S. and south Korea under the pretence of the non-existent "threat" from someone, the commentary goes on:
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries may start overseas aggression any time. The DPRK is its primary target. 
					
					 Japan is set to take part in the U.S. Asia strategy for aggression to stage a comeback to Korea and pave the way for overseas expansion, using it as a springboard. The attempt of the Japanese reactionaries to revise the above-said law is aimed at reinvading Korea with the help of the U.S.
					
					 It is under the signboard of "security" that Japan is pursuing a war to disturb peace and security. This is rendering the situation in Northeast Asia tenser and seriously threatening the sovereignty, security and interests of the DPRK and its neighboring countries. 
					
					 Those who pursue a war, swimming against the trend of the times, are bound to face a stern punishment by history. 
					
					 Japan would be well advised to face up to the trend of the times and take actions helpful to the peace and stability of the region.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Apologize for Its Past Crimes and Redeem Them
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Apologize for Its Past Crimes and Redeem Them
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Japan's settlement of its past is a key issue in normalizing the DPRK-Japan relations, observes Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a bylined commentary.
					 The process to improve the relations between the DPRK and Japan is not a bargaining, the commentary notes, and goes on: It is a matter of opening good-neighborly and friendly relations with the DPRK on the basis of Japan's full redemption of its crime-woven past. To this end, Japan should fulfill its historical responsibility.
					
					 Had the Japanese ruling quarters have the ability to foresee the future with a good judgment of the times, they would have taken practical measures for the settlement of their past before raising irrelevant issues.
					
					 Japan is, however, talking about "improved relations" with the DPRK, while concealing its past crimes. This is a just mockery of the Korean people, human conscience and justice.
					
					 The abnormal DPRK-Japan relations can never be settled as long as Japan shuns the settlement of its past. This is a lesson taught by the past talks and contacts for improving their relations.
					
					 It is illogical for Japan to call for the "improved bilateral relations" while shelving the issue of apologizing for its past wrongs and redressing them. 
					
					 The issues of confidence building and fence mending between the DPRK and Japan can be settled only through Japan's solution of the above-said issue.
					
					 Japan's settlement of its past wrongs is not a matter that allows it to behave as it pleases as regards the issue. This is an issue which Japan should clinch without fail and an urgent matter to be solved for improving its relations with the DPRK.
					
					 If Japan truly wants to see the improved relations with the DPRK, it should properly understand this basic issue and make a bold decision to redeem its past as early as possible.

articles.title: Probe into Truth behind Ryongsan Tragedy Called for
articles.content:
Probe into Truth behind Ryongsan Tragedy Called for
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- A memorial service for evacuees killed in Ryongsan was held in Seoul on Jan. 20, two years since the tragedy. It was attended by members of civic and religious organizations including the Federation of Evacuees of south Korea and the bereaved families.
					 Two years have passed since the evacuees were killed due to the police brutal suppression but truth about it has not yet been probed and those responsible not punished, they said.
					
					 Such murder as the Ryongsan tragedy is rampant in south Korea, they deplored. They called for earlier repeal of an evil law on development backed by the authorities. 
					
					 They appealed to the people from all walks of life to pool efforts to probe the truth behind the tragedy and build a world in which the people have become masters.

articles.title: Unwarranted Judgment on Rev. Han Sang Ryol Denounced
articles.content:
Unwarranted Judgment on Rev. Han Sang Ryol Denounced
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Progress of south Korea denounced the authorities for sentencing Rev. Han Sang Ryol to heavy penalty. It held a press conference on Jan. 21.
					 His Pyongyang visit can never be incriminated as it was prompted by his religious devotion and conscience, the organization said.
					
					 The judgment passed on him is anti-reunification atrocity that negates the will of the Korean nation for peaceful reunification and all exchanges that had been underway between the south and the north of Korea since the adoption of the June 15 joint declaration, it said.

articles.title: S. Korea Urged to Stop Suppression of Pro-Reunification Organization
articles.content:
S. Korea Urged to Stop Suppression of Pro-Reunification Organization
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) demanded the south Korean authorities stop suppression of its former member, according to a statement released by it on Jan. 21.
					 It also called on the authorities to immediately opt for dialogue between the north and the south of Korea.
					
					 The authorities are investigating a former core member of the Kyonggi-Inchon Confederation of Pomminryon and clamping down on him, said the statement.
					
					 This action, an extension of the suppression of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon, is an anachronistic and indiscriminate crackdown, quite contrary to the atmosphere for south-north dialogue, it said. 
					
					 No one can check the trend of the fellow countrymen advancing toward reunification by their concerted efforts and the activities of Pomminryon.

articles.title: Tuition-waiver Program to Korean Schools in Japan Demanded
articles.content:
Tuition-waiver Program to Korean Schools in Japan Demanded
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- A Japanese human rights organization demanded the government resume the procedures for applying tuition-waiver program to the Korean schools in Japan. It released a statement addressed to the prime minister, the chief Cabinet secretary and the minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan on Jan. 17. 
					 The Japanese government suspended the proceedings following the Yonphyong Island shelling in the West Sea of Korea. This is apparent violation of law and grave infringement upon the rights of students to learn, the statement said. 
					
					 The politico-diplomatic issue should not have adverse effect on the education of students who would shoulder the future, it added.

articles.title: Dialogue between North and South of Korea Urged
articles.content:
Dialogue between North and South of Korea Urged
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The Hungarian Communist Workers' Party stressed that north-south dialogue and negotiations are the only way for settling the issue of the Korean Peninsula.
					 This stand was expressed in its January 17 appeal to the communist and workers' parties in Europe. 
					
					 The appeal fully supported the DPRK joint statement of government, political parties and organizations.
					
					 It also called upon all members of the communist and workers' parties in Europe to express full support for the joint statement.

articles.title: S. Korea Urged to Respond to DPRK Proposal
articles.content:
S. Korea Urged to Respond to DPRK Proposal
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The Communist Party of Malta in a statement on January 18 urged the south Korean authorities to respond to the DPRK's proposal for national reconciliation and unity and reunification of the country.
					 We fully support the proposal for dialogue and negotiations with political parties and organizations of south Korea including the authorities, a proposal made in the DPRK joint statement of government, political parties and organizations, the statement said. 
					
					 In order to achieve peace and reunification of the Korean Peninsula it is necessary to remove danger of war from this region, it said, adding:
					
					 Dialogue and negotiations are the most realistic way for improving the inter-Korean relations at a crisis.

articles.title: Solidarity with Korean People Expressed in Iran
articles.content:
Solidarity with Korean People Expressed in Iran
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The Iranian Workers' House sent a solidarity letter to the DPRK mission in Teheran on Jan. 18 in support of the DPRK joint statement of government, political parties and organizations.
					 The DPRK's proposal for dialogue and negotiations between the north and the south of Korea is the only way for solving the issue of the Korean Peninsula by the nation itself while rejecting outsiders' interference and improving the north-south relations at a crisis, the letter said.
					
					 The DPRK joint statement is a positive step greatly helpful to the reunification movement of the Korean people, it added.
					
					 We extend firm solidarity to the struggle of all the Korean people including workers, it said.

articles.title: Joint Statement of DPRK Supported in Austria
articles.content:
Joint Statement of DPRK Supported in Austria
						
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The Federal Leadership of the Left Bloc of the Austrian Trade Union Federation released an appeal on Jan. 17 in support of the DPRK joint statement of government, political parties and organizations.
					 The organization called upon trade unions in Europe and under the World Federation of Trade Unions to positively support the DPRK proposal for dialogue and negotiations between the north and the south of Korea, a way for contributing to peace and security of the Korean Peninsula and the region.
					
					 Only dialogue and negotiations can ensure durable peace on the peninsula and the region, it said, urging the south Korean authorities to promptly accept this important proposal.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday to Be Celebrated in Cambodia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday to Be Celebrated in Cambodia
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee was formed in Cambodia on Jan. 19 to celebrate February 16, birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Kong Sam Ol, deputy prime minister in charge of the Royal Palace, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set the celebration period from January 21 to February 20 and decided to introduce the greatness and immortal exploits of Kim Jong Il through media and hold colorful events.

articles.title: MINREX organiza encuentro con miembros de embajada rusa
articles.content:
MINREX organiza encuentro con miembros de embajada rusa 
Pyongyang, 25 de enero (ATCC) -- Con motivo del Ano Nuevo, el Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea organizo este martes un encuentro de amistad con los miembros de la Embajada de la Federacion Rusa en Corea.
					Fueron invitados a la ocasion el embajador Valery Sukhinin y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica.
					
					Tambien estuvieron presentes el canciller coreano Pak Ui Chun y otros funcionarios de la cancilleria coreana.
					
					Despues de escuchar discursos, los participantes departieron sobre el desarrollo de las relaciones entre ambos paises.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia la pena impuesta al pastor Han Sang Ryol
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia la pena impuesta al pastor Han Sang Ryol
Pyongyang, 25 de enero (ATCC) -- Hace poco, el Tribunal Local Central de Seul abrio el juicio publico sobre el pastor Han Sang Ryol, quien visito en el ano pasado a Pyongyang, y lo condeno a 5 anos de prision e igual periodo de suspension de calificacion.
					  Esto significa el uso de violencia contra la justicia y conciencia de la humanidad y el sablazo contra el deseo del pueblo coreano de reunificar el pais.
					
					  Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual del dia 25 y continua:
					
					  Han Sang Ryol es la personalidad patriotica que sin quedarse con brazos cruzados ante las relaciones N-S que se acercaban cada dia mas a la fase de guerra, visito Pyongyang con la valiente decision de sacrificarse por la unidad y la reunificacion de la nacion.
					
					  El pastor Han no fue manipulado por alguien sino actuo segun su propia opcion de vivir por el patriotismo y la reunificacion.
					
					  Esta claro que reclamar la union y la reunificacion de la nacion y rechazar al dominio e  intervencion de las fuerzas extranjeras no puede ser el "elogio y la adhesion" a alguien.
					
					  La conducta del pastor no puede ser incriminada en ningun caso porque conviene a la aspiracion y la demanda de los habitantes sobre el mejoramiento de las relaciones N-S, la paz y la reunificacion.
					
					  La reunificacion es el patriotismo y justicia, y los que luchan por ella deben ser elogiados como patriotas.
					
					  Las autoridades surcoreanas deben cancelar las duras condenas impuestas al pastor Han y liberarlo incondicionalmente.
					
					  Ademas, deben abolir cuanto antes la "ley de seguridad" de caracter fascista que impide el desarrollo del libre movimiento por la reunificacion y el proceso de reconciliacion N-S.

articles.title: Minju Joson condena al ministro japones de defense
articles.content:
Minju Joson condena al ministro japones de defensa 
Pyongyang, 25 de enero (ATCC) -- Recientemente, el ministro de Defensa de Japon, Kitazawa, dijo que la tarea apremiante para la "seguridad" de Japon es profundizar la discusion en sentido institucional de los asuntos tales como el apoyo eficiente de las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" a las tropas norteamericanas en el "tiempo de emergencia de la Peninsula Coreana".
					En un comentario individual fechado 25, el periodico Minju Joson insiste en que el intento de enmendar la "ley de emergencia del contorno" parte de la siniestra ambicion de lanzar de nuevo la agresion en cooperacion militar con Estados Unidos, y continua:
					
					Pretextando la falsa teoria de la "amenaza" de alguien, Japon da acicate a las acciones expansionistas a ultramar fortaleciendo la alianza militar con EE.UU. y el Sur de Corea.
					
					Es una cuestion de tiempo que el inicie la agresion a ultramar comenzando por atacar a la RPDC.
					
					Al sumarse a la agresiva estrategia de EE.UU. sobre Asia, Japon intenta abrir el camino de expansion a ultramar agrediendo a Corea y usandola como plataforma de salto.
					
					La intencion de los reaccionarios japoneses de enmendar la "ley de emergencia del contorno" partio de la meta de lanzarse junto con EE.UU. en la nueva agresion a Corea.
					
					Detras del vistoso cartel de "seguridad", Japon destruye la paz y la seguridad persiguiendo la guerra.
					
					Debido a ello, se agrava cada dia mas la situacion del Nordeste Asiatico y se ven amenazados seriamente la soberania, la seguridad y los intereses de Corea y los paises vecinos.
					
					Los que persiguen la guerra desafiando a la corriente de la epoca seran condenados duro por la historia.
					
					Japon debe ver correctamente la tendencia actual y tomar las medidas de accion que contribuyan a la paz y la estabilidad de la region.

articles.title: Fundado en Corea el fondo de ayuda a los ancianos
articles.content:
Fundado en Corea el fondo de ayuda a los ancianos
Pyongyang, 25 de enero (ATCC) -- Nacio el Fondo de Ayuda a los Ancianos de Corea, organizacion no gubernamental registrada como ente juridico de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					Tiene por su mision principal la cooperacion por la salud y vida de los viejos y la ayuda a ellos.
					
					Sera financiado con los fondos hechos por el organo de proteccion de viejos y las donaciones de organizaciones internacionales, entidades de caridad y compatriotas en ultramar, etc.
					
					El fondo usara ese dinero en la reparacion y el mantenimiento de las instalaciones de servicio para los ancianos y de sus asilos y en la construccion de establecimientos de servicios publicos.
					
					Igualmente, lo desembolsara para redactar y difundir las publicaciones necesarias al cuidado de salud y la proteccion de los viejos, instalar los equipos de ejercicio fisico y de rehabilitacion, producir los tonicos, etc.
					
					Se establecera la red de ordenadores para informar como marchan las labores de proteccion de los viejos en distintas localidades.
					
					La vicepresidenta del Comite Central de la Federacion de Proteccion de los Ancianos de Corea, Ri Chol Hui (de 63 anos de edad), dijo a la ATCC que el fondo dinamizara el intercambio y la cooperacion con diversos paises del mundo y organizaciones internacionales.

articles.title: Fabricados en Corea carteles de nuevo tipo
articles.content:
Fabricados en Corea carteles de nuevo tipo
Pyongyang, 25 de enero (ATCC) -- Se han hecho en Corea nuevos carteles con el molde plastico y las lamparillas LED.
					En el fondo blanco de ellos aparecen las letras de varios estilos caligraficos en distintos colores.
					
					Aparte de su larga duracion, tienen menor costo de produccion y ahorran el 60 % de electricidad en comparacion con lamparas fluorescentes.
					
					Ahora nuevos carteles se instalan en la ciudad de Pyongyang y las otras.
					
					Los carteles colocados en el Almacen No. 1 de Pyongyang, los restaurantes de la avenida de restaurantes Changgwang, la sala de videojuegos del Parque Juventud de Kaeson y otros establecimientos de recreo y de servicios gastronomicos muestran un maravilloso panorama nocturno.
